<a id="class_CSGCylinder3D"></a>

# CSGCylinder3D

**Inherits:** [CSGPrimitive3D](class_csgprimitive3d.md) **<** [CSGShape3D](class_csgshape3d.md) **<** [GeometryInstance3D](class_geometryinstance3d.md) **<** [VisualInstance3D](class_visualinstance3d.md) **<** [Node3D](class_node3d.md) **<** [Node](class_node.md) **<** [Object](class_object.md)

A CSG Cylinder shape.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

This node allows you to create a cylinder (or cone) for use with the CSG system.

\ **Note:** CSG nodes are intended to be used for level prototyping. Creating CSG nodes has a significant CPU cost compared to creating a [MeshInstance3D](class_meshinstance3d.md) with a [PrimitiveMesh](class_primitivemesh.md). Moving a CSG node within another CSG node also has a significant CPU cost, so it should be avoided during gameplay.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Tutorials

- [Prototyping levels with CSG](../tutorials/3d/csg_tools.md)

## Property Descriptions

<a id="class_CSGCylinder3D_property_cone"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](class_bool.md) **cone** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#class_CSGCylinder3D_property_cone)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_cone**\ (\ value\: [bool](class_bool.md)\ )
- [bool](class_bool.md) **is_cone**\ (\ )

If ``true`` a cone is created, the [radius](class_csgcylinder3d.md#class_CSGCylinder3D_property_radius) will only apply to one side.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_CSGCylinder3D_property_height"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](class_float.md) **height** = `2.0` [ðŸ”—](#class_CSGCylinder3D_property_height)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_height**\ (\ value\: [float](class_float.md)\ )
- [float](class_float.md) **get_height**\ (\ )

The height of the cylinder.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_CSGCylinder3D_property_material"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Material](class_material.md) **material** [ðŸ”—](#class_CSGCylinder3D_property_material)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_material**\ (\ value\: [Material](class_material.md)\ )
- [Material](class_material.md) **get_material**\ (\ )

The material used to render the cylinder.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_CSGCylinder3D_property_radius"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](class_float.md) **radius** = `0.5` [ðŸ”—](#class_CSGCylinder3D_property_radius)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_radius**\ (\ value\: [float](class_float.md)\ )
- [float](class_float.md) **get_radius**\ (\ )

The radius of the cylinder.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_CSGCylinder3D_property_sides"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](class_int.md) **sides** = `8` [ðŸ”—](#class_CSGCylinder3D_property_sides)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_sides**\ (\ value\: [int](class_int.md)\ )
- [int](class_int.md) **get_sides**\ (\ )

The number of sides of the cylinder, the higher this number the more detail there will be in the cylinder.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_CSGCylinder3D_property_smooth_faces"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](class_bool.md) **smooth_faces** = `true` [ðŸ”—](#class_CSGCylinder3D_property_smooth_faces)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_smooth_faces**\ (\ value\: [bool](class_bool.md)\ )
- [bool](class_bool.md) **get_smooth_faces**\ (\ )

If ``true`` the normals of the cylinder are set to give a smooth effect making the cylinder seem rounded. If ``false`` the cylinder will have a flat shaded look.
